subject: Make secure RBAC protection job voting

values.-1: This patch needs further work before it can be merged
values.+1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Patch Set 18:

Do we really want to do this now? In xena when we going to work on system persona then again we have to make it non voting, right?

Patch Set 18:

> Patch Set 18:
> 
> Do we really want to do this now? In xena when we going to work on system persona then again we have to make it non voting, right?

I think we have options for adding additional tests. We can make this job non-voting in the future, or we can skip specific tests that we know will fail. I already proposed something similar for the system-scope tests I wrote originally [0].

At this point, I would like to try and sweep some of the authorization bits out of the lower layers before we start adding system-scope support. Otherwise, each place that checks for some authorization in the context object might need to be tweaked to handle system-scope or we need to encapsulate all that logic into a special, potentially backwards compatible, context property (e.g., context.is_admin).

Either way, I'd feel much more comfortable going into a refactor that invasive with these tests enabled, even if project-member/project-reader functionality is considered experimental. I think it will be easier to fold in the system-scope support if we consolidate some of the authorization logic (I guess this is just my way of saying I think we need to pay down some technical debt before we continue adding more personas, and to do that I would like/prefer to have these tests voting.)

But, I'm curious to hear if others have a different strategy.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/glance-tempest-plugin/+/778343

Patch Set 18:

> > Do we really want to do this now? In xena when we going to work on system persona then again we have to make it non voting, right?

No real reason not to keep it voting between now and then, although I guess I'd hope we could land changes to the tests before code and keep everything working, otherwise we will have broken a user anyway (I know, experimental).
 
> I think we have options for adding additional tests. We can make this job non-voting in the future, or we can skip specific tests that we know will fail. I already proposed something similar for the system-scope tests I wrote originally [0].
> 
> At this point, I would like to try and sweep some of the authorization bits out of the lower layers before we start adding system-scope support. Otherwise, each place that checks for some authorization in the context object might need to be tweaked to handle system-scope or we need to encapsulate all that logic into a special, potentially backwards compatible, context property (e.g., context.is_admin).

Yeah, I cringe thinking about this work, but it surely seems like the only way to really do system scope right is to pull actual enforcement of most of the things into the policy layer first.

> Either way, I'd feel much more comfortable going into a refactor that invasive with these tests enabled, even if project-member/project-reader functionality is considered experimental. I think it will be easier to fold in the system-scope support if we consolidate some of the authorization logic (I guess this is just my way of saying I think we need to pay down some technical debt before we continue adding more personas, and to do that I would like/prefer to have these tests voting.)

Agree. I think we might want to move at least the base case into one of the other jobs (i.e. make them test legacy-rbac incidentally) just to avoid running another tempest and devstack just for these tests. If we made our -import job use legacy and our -import-standalone job use secure (and include those names), I would think we'd get the same coverage without losing too much granularity for what-failed-and-why. That way we're not running more jobs (and thus not running flaky non-glance tests more often), but we are getting this cover.
Uploaded patch set 19: Patch Set 18 was rebased.

Patch Set 19: Workflow-1

I squashed this into the patch that adds the release note, under the assumption that when we claim it's implemented (reno) we're also testing/voting on the feature. Assuming that's okay with people, we can abandon this to clean up our stack.

Abandoned

Squashed into https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/glance/+/779070
